definition: to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)

sentences.english: Well, all the same stuff as in the Apple store half a mile away on Regent Street.
sentences.chinese: 半公里外的摄政街苹果旗舰店也有同样的商品。

sentences.english: So, his planned Regent's palacewas shelved.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他计划的摄政王府被搁置。

sentences.english: Rows of flags along Regent Street, London, in preparation for the royal wedding. Photograph: Carl Court/PA
sentences.chinese: 沿着伦敦摄政街一排排的旗帜，在为皇室婚礼做准备。

sentences.english: The idea is that Mr Chang will act as a kind of regent.
sentences.chinese: 张成泽将扮演摄政王的角色，支持金正云。

sentences.english: Tesla grabbed the false Regent by the cowl and dragged him to his knees.
sentences.chinese: 泰斯拉一把抓住假摄政王的肉甲，把他拖到地上跪下。

sentences.english: The house itself was full of Regency furniture.
sentences.chinese: 这所住宅到处陈列着摄政时期的家具。

sentences.english: " one of the Invid cut him off. "The Regent killed?
sentences.chinese: 其中一个因维人打断了他，“摄政王被杀了？

sentences.english: The lodgings selected faced the Regent Gardens.
sentences.chinese: 这所选定的公寓面对着摄政公园。

sentences.english: The regent carried out an advanced system in his country.
sentences.chinese: 摄政者在他的国家推行了一套先进的制度。

sentences.english: For your next visit to Kuwait, look no further than The Regency Kuwait.
sentences.chinese: 你下次访问科威特，看看没有进一步的比科威特摄政。

sentences.english: When the king left on the Second Crusade he appointed Suger regent and left him in charge of the government.
sentences.chinese: 国王在第二次东征前任命苏杰摄政和负责政府。

definition: to hold a court audience/to govern from the imperial throne (applies esp. to Empress Dowager or Regent)
to succeed to a title/to inherit
